data.title: Good Authentic Mexican Food!!!!!!!!!!
data.text: I don't dare try any new authentic Mexican restaurants because honestly, they are hard to find.  But when you're from out of town and craving a good homestyle breakfast, you rely on your instincts. I'm glad I did.  Don Juan's is a super busy restaurant, at least it was on Sunday when we were there, but the service was fast and friendly.  There is a variety of menu selections and breakfast is served ALL DAY!!!  My kind of place!  Our waiter took good care of us.  I loved the atmosphere, very family oriented.  I will make it a point to stop by here everytime I'm in Tyler.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Great but noisy.. Took a bit to get seated.)prices ok.drinks ok.wait staff slow. Wint go during business work hours..too stacked up.

data.title: Family
data.text: It was nice, but small.  Staff was attentive not real personable. Food was good, didn't get much for the price.

data.title: Authentic Mexican food with a crazy good atmosphere!
data.text: I love this place and have never been disappointed! The food is always good and you can order just about anything you want. The wait staff is delightful and eager to please. I like to customize my soft tacos and I always order the top shelf margarita.

data.title: EZ to get in and out
data.text: Got in early and it was jammed by the lunch crowd. Too easy access for the people working on the square. Food was good, hot, and tasty. The jalapenos were gringo hot or not hot. The Chile Relleno was tasty. Friends enjoyed the reliable chicken enchiladas. The margaritas were just right.

data.title: Very good authentic Tex-Mex
data.text: My wife and I stopped in for a Saturday lunch and the food was great. As a San Antonio native, I have high expectations for anyone serving Tex Mex and Don's did not disappoint. The food was great and the prices were very reasonable.

data.title: Great food for the price
data.text: Great selection of homemade food served by the friendly staff.  My friends and I always order different things and try them off each others plates.  We have not had anything that was not great tasting. We can sit have great food and conversation.

data.title: My favorite Mexican place on Earth!
data.text:
Don Juan on the Square is amazing! Nothing special or exceptional, juts great food! I've never had anything bad on the menu, but the steak fajitas are especially great! Really good chips and salsa and great queso. Nice location in downtown Tyler.

I love this place!

data.title: A favorite of Tyler Locals for years!
data.text: Great food in the middle of downtown Tyler, Texas!  Don Juan's is a great lunch place when doing business in the city or going out for dinner at night.  You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Good food, service and atmosphere - salsa pretty spicy for kids
data.text:
The parking situation sucks - metered parking. We found street side a couple blocks north and parked for free but that's kind of annoying.

I thought all the food was good. The kids thought the salsa was a little too spicy for their liking but they kept eating it anyway. The restaurant itself was kind of cold inside and the kids complained about that too.

It seems I was the only one really satisfied of the group.

I would still recommend it and would go back. I've noticed an uptrend in Mexican restaurants lately putting vegetables in the rice. That is disgusting and ruins good rice. Fortunately this place does NOT do that so they get extra points for that.

data.title: Good food, Great prices
data.text: My kids love the caso. Try the Tuesday Special, BEEF TORTA, Great sandwich at a great price. Locally owned and always clean. Food quality is a constant.

data.title: Honestly
data.text: We went kind of late but it does not excuse this place from serving bland food. The chips were too thick and bland as if they had been sitting all day.  I was expecting salsa (tomato based) but got chile rojo and chile verde. Both chiles were good but on tacos. had the "best kept secret in Tyler" and wished I had never stepped foot in the door. I did not even get 1/4 way through the greasy bland mix of meat and cheese before leaving. Not very traditional at all. Seriously, on the border is ten times better. I wanted to try local and was dissapointed. Will not go back.

data.title: Some of the best Mexican food in Tyler!
data.text:
We thought finding a parking spot downtown might be difficult at noon on a Tuesday, but we had no problem finding a good spot.  When we walked in we could see the restaurant was crowded, but the hostess asked if we wanted to eat upstairs.  Upstairs?  We had no idea there would be dining on both levels.  

We walked up the stairs and found there was plenty of room there.  Service was quick and the waiter was attentive.  I wasn't sure what to eat, so I ordered a combination plate that had grilled steak, two enchiladas (I chose chicken), tortillas, rice, and beans.  It was all delicious!  Very different from most of the Mexican food (or Tex-Mex) in Tyler.  

I will most definitely be dining there again - and soon!

data.title: Very good traditional Mexican.
data.text:
Have been here 20+ times over the years. Often busy but service is always kind, hard working and prompt. 

Food is very consistent. They have a large variety of menu choices. If you want Tex Mex they have it, but also have more traditional choices. 

My current fav is #29, the Juanita. Basically a kitchen sink pile of layered tortillas, meats and cheeses. Very good. 

A fun and festive dining room and a great break from the standard chain style Tex mex.

data.title: Great spot for tacos!
data.text: One of my husband and my favorite Friday treats is a Big Steves margarita. They make it with fresh lime and Corrlejo reposado tequila. Yum! The tacos here are Cheap!! And a great deal for the price!! It's in a great locale downtown!

data.title: Not All That
data.text:
Went to this restaurant based upon the reviews. Guess there is not a lot of choice in Tyler.

Things this restaurant got right:
 - great ambiance
 - attentive staff
 - good tortillas
 - good queso

Got wrong:
 - flavored and regular margaritas
 - guacamole
 - fajitas
 - chips

We ordered the mango and strawberry margaritas which were way too sweet and the lime one tasted too much of fake mix. The chips were tasteless but the hot sauces were decent. The main disappointment was the Felipes Parrillada which was a combo fajita entree of steak, pork, chicken and shrimp. Sounded good to the three of us - the menu says it is enough for 3 but could have easily served 5. It is served on a large metal box with a sterno type light inside to keep the meat warm. Unfortunately, all it did was overcook and char everything touching the box. It also made the meal taste like the flammable liquid that was used for the fire. The pork tasted like it had been cooked and reheated.

We really did want to like this restaurant, but will not be going back. My daughters had stomach aches for most of the evening.

data.title: Yummy tacos ...
data.text: The portions are generous and prices reasonable ... can highly recommend the brisket tacos!  It's kinda noisy during standard meal times but the off-hours 2-4 pm seem fairly peaceful!  LOL

data.title: Awesome authentic Mexican Food
data.text: In my opinion, the best Mexican Restaurant in town (along with the original restaurant on E. Erwin).  I would highly recommend this to anyone.

data.title: Fabulous Margaritas!
data.text:
We know where to head on Fridays, Don Juan's!! This place is the best Mexican in town, and it's at a beyond reasonable price. You can get $2 tacos, or the BEST cheese "dip" (you can't really dip anything in this block of melted cheese), or a pile of fajita beef. The food here has a tendency to be spicier than most Tex-Mex places, especially the salsa, but we LOVE spicy. 

The secret of Don Juan's is the Steve's Margarita. They make it with Correlejo Reposado Tequila, which is the BEST tequila for margaritas. The rest of the recipe is unknown, but I gave you the main ingredient :) Please, for everyone else's sake, just have ONE! (you can order a small, if you're usually a light drinker).

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Tyler!  They have the BEST Mexican food.  Now...it is not Tex-Mex.  It's more authentic than that.  They have the best tacos and the value can't be beat.
